post.body: might want to try reloading. Again, I'll be focusing on speed shortly. Just trying to work on layout FTM.
what browser?
I'll be fixing that shortly - need to turn on caching.
that would be nice, save me some time. Wondering how FriendFeed's getting around that.
you may want a !important on your css for your blog widgets. See it on staynalive.com - my white text goes through.
if they received something in return for posting, its a form of PPP. I'm not saying I disagree with it. It's still PPP though
they're still a form of Pay-per-post. Izea is facilitating it, and they're a PPP company.
e-mail me at jesse@staynalive.com - I'll cc you with @todaysmama and we can schedule lunch
I'm just trying to figure out where I go to get embed code.
do you guys offer ability to embed images in blogs? Or should I just download and re-upload?
are you hoping the funeral is in California or Utah? I'm kinda hoping for CA, but UT would be more convenient.
keep me in your beta testing - I'd love to test and review it.
avatar will remain the same (well, at least for the next few hours) ;-)
well, I made the prediction - favorite it, and we'll see if I'm right. :-)
visibility is part of it. Mostly, I'm doing it for the fun of it.
chances are if you start using that profile it won't last long though. Facebook monitors those religiously.
correct.
it means it's an easy thing for people to identify themselves. They are most likely already registered, as one of the 140 million.
That's the interesting part - it would change the landscape of blogging. You would be forced to think twice before registering.
my original Tweet was about removing anonymity from RSS.
you're most likely already registered for these services. There are 140 million people on Facebook.
Last prediction for today (for 2009): Facebook will launch FB Connect for the iPhone. (I actually predicted that a few months ago)
Oh, and btw, my prediction of SixApart competing with Twitter is already on its way: http://is.gd/bTay
One more prediction for next year: @scobleizer and @FastCompany will do something with all these posts he has been liking on FriendFeed.
Weâ€™re Related Proves Families are Popular on Facebook http://ff.im/-iQjj
I'm trying to figure out what other widgets I need in the sidebar on http://staynalive.com - any suggestions?
I admit - I'm jealous of the PPP Izea bloggers. I'd do one in a heartbeat for a $500 gift card. Only on my own blog though, if it made sense
Facebook needs an "Anniversaries" section in addition to "Birthdays" - another potential revenue opportunity?
Wedding Picture Meme! http://ff.im/-iqiy
Reflection http://ff.im/-ipu2
Potential Applications of Facebook Connect in E-Commerce http://ff.im/-inbI
(@pattih05k is my cousin)
Wow - my son just brought me animal crackers. He doesn't even know, but my grandma used to always buy us animal crackers when we were kids.
Just got word that my grandmother passed away - she lived a long life, and I'm sure she's anxious to be back with my Grandfather.
Gasp! @scobleizer you must be going nuts right now. FriendFeed's down! ;-)
Feeds are finished. Now getting my first food of the day.
Someone needs to write an iPhone app that meshes weather with Google Maps and tells me what the weather will be like each minute of my trip.
FYI, my Twitter username's about to change - please pay attention and I'll let you know when it happens. I'll announce it on my blog too.
I'm down to 500 feeds now - almost done!
The new i.TV app is making me want to get a Tivo now just so I can remote-schedule recordings.
